channel.title: Guidance on Hearts & Souls RPG?
channel.description:
Hi,
Heard about Hearts & Souls on the latest Gauntlet Podcast and picked it up. So far I like the premise a great deal. Want to run a supers game that is less crunchy than Champions/Hero Systems.
I am a little confused as to how some things like character creation works. It seems to be: just have an idea and flesh it out with your GM (or Editor as the game calls it). Is this correct? There isn't a more structured method? Guidance for how many attributes should be ordinary, human, superhuman, exceptional, etc.. Tried looking up reviews or playthroughs but "Hearts and Souls" gets a lot of results that are not related to the RPG at all.
BTW the version I picked up is this one from Drivethru RPG: https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/3310/Hearts--Souls
Is that the correct/latest version?
Any feedback would be greatly appreciated!

item.title: Guidance on Hearts & Souls RPG?
item.dc:creator: @RichRogers
item.description:
@RichRogers wrote:

Lochmonster:

It seems to be: just have an idea and flesh it out with your GM (or Editor as the game calls it). Is this correct?

Yup, that’s how it works. Just come up with a concept that fits in the frame of the comic and assign mechanics as you see fit, working with the GM.

Lochmonster:

Is that the correct/latest version?

That is the latest version, yes.
